title: What are these cursive, handwritten script fonts?
content:
Hi there! I would like to know what these fonts are. One of them is taken from the header image of [http://www.laurenslatest.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420044921/http:/www.laurenslatest.com/ "http://www.laurenslatest.com/") and I can't remember the origin of the other one.

Thanks in advance! :)

p.s. i'm not too sure how to describe these fonts, hope the terms, cursive and handwritten script, fit the bill.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [3-3-2013 4-45-13 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420044921/http:/typophile.com/files/3-3-2013%204-45-13%20PM.png) | 32.55 KB |
| [3-3-2013 11-37-15 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420044921/http:/typophile.com/files/3-3-2013%2011-37-15%20PM.png) | 35.34 KB |
author: shubbing

comments.content: Wow, that was fast. Thanks for your help!
"Everyone has bad days": [Pacifico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420044921/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/pacifico) by Vernon Adams

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420044921im_/http:/typophile.com/files/imagine_a_woman_3692.jpg)
  
Hi - can someone identify the name of this scriptish font?  
Thanks!

kchinh:

your sample looks (to me) like a mix of fonts. I'd suggest Cezanne for the caps, and perhaps Rodin for the lowercase.

edit: and, I'd suggest when you need assistance, create a new thread to prevent your request being overlooked or confusing the conversations.
